query: What circumstantial evidence supports the fraud allegation?
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: What circumstantial evidence supports the fraud allegation?

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[Patrick Stockton Outline #1.docx, p.1]
There is no evidence in the record of Stockton escalating any paint mismatch or delay to St. Louis before parts were returned.

[Damage Summary Handout for Tribunal.docx, p.1]
Loss Type | Amount (EUR) | Supporting Evidence

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Ask whether he has seen any evidence that a forecasting discussion took place for this Proposal.

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Q: So your expert opinion is limited to the documents Gulfstream gave you, and you reviewed no primary evidence from CITIOM or on-site personnel?

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Q: You reviewed no evidence that this tool was applied to the quote?

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
CITIOM purchased the Gulfstream G550 aircraft bearing MSN 5174 (the “Aircraft”) in late 2018 / early 2019 from NetJets. [See CITE EVIDENCE OF PURCHASE].

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
Gulfstream also performed maintenance on the Aircraft in July-August 2023, which was the last maintenance performed by Gulfstream before the 192-month inspection. [See CITE EVIDENCE]. This involved work on the leading edges and the APU area. I believe corrosion issues later found during the 192-month inspection should have been identified and addressed during this July 2023 maintenance or even during the 144-month inspection.

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
Around the end of February 2024, I first learned the Aircraft's maintenance would not be complete until mid-late April 2024. [CITE EVIDENCE]. As a result, I had to rearrange certain of my plans to use the Aircraft. This initial delay was disappointing but seemed manageable.

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.8]
Aircraft input was in January 2024. There is no evidence of proactive revision or

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.15]
This disconnect further supports CITIOM’s claim that Gulfstream knowingly or recklessly

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.25]
inspection durations supports the inference that these misrepresentations are part of a broader

[Claimant CITIOM Pre-Hearing Brief - Apr 14 2025 (1).pdf, p.32]
conduct supports a finding not only of initial misrepresentation, but of continuing fraud - or at

[1-570 Redacted Combined_20250513014404 copy pages 1 - 570.pdf, p.187]
Repair exchange will be available 6/3 and supports need date

[1-570 Redacted Combined_20250513014404 copy pages 1 - 570.pdf, p.240]
• Repair exchange will be available 6/3 and supports need date

- Found relevant excerpts in repository documents
- See excerpts above for specific citations
